p: Social cohesion was also considered to be highly reparable, highlighting a sense of strong social and cultural resources present in the Pacific Islands. Strong and enduring social cohesion is grounded in the connectedness and solidarity within countries, people feeling a part of a ‘community’ and a strong relationship between its members. In the Pacific Islands, varied and ‘tight’ networks within social and familial bonds have previously proved critical for rebuilding and recovery efforts, and can also be strengthened and reinforced in the face of adversities such as extreme weather events (Latai-Niusulu et al. 2020).
